holidays.name: Cat Herders Day
holidays.description: A whimsical celebration dedicated to the impossible task of herding cats‚Äîwhether literal felines or metaphorical chaos in life! It honors those brave souls who try to organize the unorganizable.
holidays.origin: Inspired by the famous humorous phrase 'herding cats' referring to managing something uncontrollable. The day was created as a fun nod to chaos management.
holidays.funFact: The phrase 'like herding cats' has been part of English slang since at least the 1940s, and this day celebrates that shared understanding of chaos.

holidays.name: National Cupcake Day (UK)
holidays.description: A delightful day to indulge in sweet, frosted cupcake treats, celebrating one of the most beloved bite-sized desserts around!
holidays.origin: Began as a promotional day by bakeries and sweet brands in the UK to encourage cupcake consumption during the winter months.
holidays.funFact: This holiday often supports charities with cupcake sales, turning indulgence into goodwill.

holidays.name: International Tea Day
holidays.description: A day to appreciate the cultural, economic, and social importance of tea worldwide and enjoy a comforting cuppa!
holidays.origin: Declared by the UN in 2019 to raise awareness of the impact tea cultivation has on farmers and economies globally.
holidays.funFact: Tea is the most widely consumed beverage in the world after water, with over 3 billion cups consumed daily!

holidays.name: Bill of Rights Day (USA)
holidays.description: Commemorates the ratification of the first 10 amendments to the U.S. Constitution, reminding us of the rights and freedoms guaranteed to citizens.
holidays.origin: Marks the adoption of the Bill of Rights on December 15, 1791.
holidays.funFact: The Bill of Rights was originally a compromise to appease Anti-Federalists who wanted more protections for individuals.
